availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel McRoberts (Rowan County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive)

body.p: Rowan County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive. Kentucky native. Married to Miranda McRoberts. Father of Elizabeth McRoberts, Barbara McRoberts, James McRoberts, Rebecca J. McRoberts, Aaron McRoberts, David R. McRoberts, Daniel W. McRoberts, Michael P. McRoberts, William McRoberts, Kerilla McRoberts, and Margaret McRoberts. Gunsmith in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Rowan County in 1860. Indicted for stealing horses in 1861. Fugitive from Lewis County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 339B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rowan County, Morehead, p. 613.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rowan County, Pine Grove, p. 132A.
KYR-0001-021-0017.
